title: PBL Curriculum for Developing Critical Thinking and Interpersonal Skills in Healthcare Professional Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and elementary-level understanding of human body systems
context.additional_context: As working professionals, designing activities optimized for smartphone-based learning environments while efficiently utilizing limited time

learning_goals: Through medical case analysis, learners can apply at least three or more critical thinking strategies (e.g., hypothesis testing, evidence evaluation).
In PBL team activities, learners improve interpersonal skills (communication, conflict management) based on peer feedback.

Graduate students identify three learning issues (LIs) encountered in scientific research over 2–4 weeks, document the problem-solving process step-by-step, and submit weekly reflective journals (including problem definition, strategies, analysis, and improvements) to their advisor.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
